topic: Credit Requirements for Students by End of 6th Semester

correspondence.message: If a student is required to accumulate 120 credits by the end of their 6th semester but falls short and has only earned 110 credits, what are the consequences? Is there a possibility for a second chance to reach the required number of credits?"

The consequences of not meeting the credit requirements generally include disenrollment from the degree program, and the student would not be able to study this degree program or a subject-related program at any other German university. However, universities of applied sciences are excluded from this.
